intro: Oenothera scintillans, commonly known as the blazing star, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the late afternoon. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Oenothera scintillans is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its role in supporting pollinators like bees and moths.
